## Dot Density Map - Raster to Vector Transform


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo = FALSE}

# Load density file
the_raster <- raster("../archetypes/gpw-v4-population-count-2020/gpw-v4-population-count_2020.tif")
the_raster

levels(the_raster)
cellStats(the_raster, sd)
hist(the_raster)



```


```{r, echo=FALSE}

the_raster_df <- as.data.frame(the_raster, xy = TRUE) 
str(the_raster_df)

# remove loaded file
rm(the_raster)

```




```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.width=12, fig.height=6}

the_raster_df <- filter( the_raster_df, mex_pd_2020_1km_UNadj != "NA")
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.width=12, fig.height=6}

theme_opts <- theme(
  legend.position = "none",
  legend.title = element_blank(),
  axis.text = element_blank(),
  axis.line = element_blank(),
  axis.ticks = element_blank(),
  axis.title = element_blank(),
  panel.grid = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
  panel.background=element_rect(fill="white", colour="white"),
  panel.border = element_blank(),
  plot.background = element_blank(),
)

# PLOT NATURAL EARTH BORDERS
ne_world <- ne_countries(scale = "small", returnclass = "sf")
# class(ne_world)

# removes Antarctica
ne_world <- filter(ne_world, iso_a3 == "MEX") 

v1 <- ggplot(data = ne_world) +
  geom_sf(fill="#ffffff", color="#666666", stroke=0.25) +
  geom_raster(data = the_raster_df,
              aes(x = x, y = y, alpha = mex_pd_2020_1km_UNadj) ) + 
  scale_alpha_continuous(range =  c(0.1, 0.9), guide = "none") +
  coord_sf() +
  theme_opts

v1


```
